description: From Bowser (“a surname”), after Sylvanus Bowser, US inventor of the first fuel pump; also a trade name of SF Bowser inc., the inventor's company.

entries.meaning: (now chiefly Australia and New Zealand) A fuel metering/delivery pump at a filling station.
examples: The Moree Municipal Council decided to devote the revenue derived from the rent of the bowser petrol pumps within the municipality for this year, which amounted to forty guineas.

entries.meaning: A road vehicle (often a trailer) for the transport of liquid fuel, particularly aviation fuel at an airfield.
examples: The bowsers then go out to the aircraft and supply them with petrol.

entries.meaning: (Britain) A mobile water tank deployed to distribute fresh water in emergency situations where the normal system of piped distribution has broken down or is insufficient.
examples: Mr. Deputy Speaker, Sir, as hon. Shidie has said, there is no water bowser in Garissa and he categorically said that there is a water bowser to supply water to the people of Kulan. Could he give the registration number of this water bowser which is supplying water to the people of Kulan?

entries.meaning: (Ireland, slang, used in the vocative) A buffoon or imbecile.
